posts.title: Getting Started with React Router
posts.body: React Router enables navigation between views in a React application without reloading the page. It helps in building single-page applications with clean URLs and better user experience.

posts.title: Understanding useEffect in React
posts.body: The useEffect hook allows you to perform side effects in functional components. It is commonly used for data fetching, subscriptions, and manually changing the DOM.

posts.title: State vs Props in React
posts.body: Props are used to pass data from parent to child components, while state is used to manage data within a component. Understanding the difference is crucial for building scalable React apps.

posts.title: Building a Simple Blog App in React  123
posts.body: A blog app is a great way to learn React fundamentals. It involves routing, form handling, state management, and CRUD operations using local storage or an API.
